item.title: NHS fees to be scrapped for overseas health staff and care workers
item.description: NHS staff and care workers from abroad are to be exempt, as Labour calls it "the right thing to do".

item.title: Coronavirus: Virus test with 20-minute results being trialled
item.description: Ten million antibody tests will also start being rolled out next week, Health Secretary Matt Hancock says.

item.title: Coronavirus: Scottish lockdown easing to begin next week
item.description: First Minister Nicola Sturgeon unveils a four-phase "route map" aimed at relaxing the coronavirus restrictions.

item.title: Coronavirus: UK's ninth Clap for Carers
item.description: From a helipad to the streets, millions thank front-line workers risking their lives to fight coronavirus.

item.title: Missing Louise Smith: Body found in Havant teenager search
item.description: After a two-week search for Louise Smith, 16, officers find human remains in a Hampshire woodland.

item.title: 'We now go to... Robbie Savage?' Coronavirus briefing takes unexpected turn
item.description: No, your eyes didn't deceive you. That was Robbie Savage asking Matt Hancock a question.

item.title: Coronavirus: Some NI pupils to return to school in August
item.description: Children in key year groups will return ahead of others, says the education minister.

item.title: Coronavirus: Resort locals 'shocked and angry' at beach crowds
item.description: Seaside town dwellers complain of crowds of people ignoring health fears for "a jolly on the beach".

item.title: US pulling out of 'Open Skies' arms control deal
item.description: The major accord permits unarmed surveillance flights over dozens of participating countries.

item.title: China proposes controversial Hong Kong security law
item.description: The law could ban what Beijing defines as subversion and sedition, and may spark new social unrest.

item.title: Grandmother ordered to delete Facebook photos under GDPR
item.description: Privacy laws mean a grandmother needs her daughter's permission to post photos of her grandchildren.

item.title: Coronavirus: French brothers strike gold under lockdown
item.description: Two children, aged about 10, make a valuable discovery as they build a shelter in their garden.

item.title: Harry Potter first edition found in skip sells for £33,000
item.description: An expert says the hardback Philosopher's Stone first edition is "the Holy Grail" for collectors.

item.title: Robot dog tries to herd sheep
item.description: The Spot robot was designed for search and rescue - but may find work in the farming industry.

item.title: Emmerdale to show characters dealing with lockdown
item.description: The soap has begun its "phased return to filming", after coming to a halt in March due to Covid-19.

item.title: Coronavirus: Film and photo project focuses on front-line NHS staff
item.description: Front-line NHS staff have contributed to a short film and photo series about "the hands that make us proud".

item.title: Coronavirus: Couple's 'incredible' virtual New York trip
item.description: Barbara and Ed Higgins missed out on a dream holiday - but still "went" on it, thanks to their family.

item.title: Spandau Ballet, a radio quiz, one syllable - and a $10,000 riddle
item.description: When a Singaporean quizzer lost a huge cash prize over one syllable, he got some unlikely help.

item.title: Coronavirus: 'Fires were tough, but closing Mogo Zoo again was even harder'
item.description: Only weeks after reopening, Australia's fire-ravaged Mogo Zoo had to close again because of Covid-19.

item.title: Coronavirus: Swimmers' joy as Tamworth quarry reopens
item.description: Swimmers film their return to Dosthill Quarry where strict social distancing measures are in place.

item.title: Miami riots 1980: My friend was killed by my colleagues
item.description: After four white policemen were acquitted of killing a black man, Miami descended into chaos in 1980.

item.title: Lockdown: South African actors create a hit online soap opera
item.description: A group of South African actors in lockdown are making a hit online soap opera from their homes.

item.title: ‘I’m very aware of my body changing in lockdown’
item.description: People who go the extra mile for their appearance on how they've reacted to their changing looks.

item.title: Leaving lockdown in Scotland: What can you do - and when?
item.description: Scotland's plan for exiting lockdown will be in four phases. So, what's happening with schools, pubs, hairdressers and gyms?

item.title: Coronavirus: Running a campaign from home in lockdown
item.description: Campaigners are not letting restrictions hold them back in fighting for what they believe in.

item.title: ‘I wrote my wife a poem every day for 25 years’
item.description: Actor Peter Gordon raises the bar for romantic gestures.

item.title: Coronavirus: Universities fear fall in lucrative overseas students
item.description: Education is one of the sectors of the global economy that is being hardest hit by the pandemic.

item.title: Coronavirus: Sleepless nights for doctors in a war zone
item.description: People in Afghanistan dared to hope for peace, but they are now fighting both violence and the virus.

item.title: Coronavirus: What does it mean for natural disaster response?
item.description: How are emergency services preparing for natural disasters amid the coronavirus pandemic?

item.title: Man Utd reveal £28m cost of coronavirus - and expect figure to rise
item.description: Manchester United say the coronavirus pandemic has cost them an initial £28m - and expect the final figure to be far higher.

item.title: EFL to keep promotion and relegation if season ended early
item.description: Promotion and relegation will remain in the English Football League if seasons are ended amid the coronavirus crisis.

item.title: Did Jordan go too far? Or was he a great leader? Amaechi and Syed debate
item.description: Former NBA player John Amaechi and journalist Matthew Syed debate on BBC Radio 5 Live whether Michael Jordan's leadership techniques in The Last Dance crossed the line.

item.title: Prince Abdullah remains Sheff Utd owner, say club
item.description: Sheffield United say Prince Abdullah remains their owner - despite Companies House suggesting otherwise.

item.title: Championship League: Snooker to return from 1 June
item.description: Snooker will resume in the UK on 1 June with its first tournament since the outbreak of the coronavirus pandemic.

item.title: Friday's gossip: Barca lower price of Arsenal & Man Utd target Umtiti
item.description: Barcelona lower valuation of Umtiti, Manchester United have clear path to sign Koulibaly, Pjanic to turn down Premier Legue move, plus more.

item.title: Coronavirus: Should I defer going to university? And other questions
item.description: Can you start driving lessons again? and other questions answered by BBC experts.

item.title: Coronavirus: How does contact tracing work and is my data safe?
item.description: Millions in the UK will soon be asked to monitor who they have been near to combat coronavirus.

item.title: Coronavirus lockdown: Why can some of us meet six people?
item.description: Different policies are down to a number of factors, including geography, science and politics, experts say.

item.title: Coronavirus UK map: How many confirmed cases are there in your area?
item.description: Key graphics explaining how coronavirus has spread in the UK and the government's response.

item.title: Coronavirus: What is the R number and how is it calculated?
item.description: The number at the heart of the decision whether to lift lockdown.

item.title: Lockdown update: All you need to know about new measures
item.description: How will social and work life be different after the easing of some restrictions in England?

item.title: Coronavirus: What are social distancing and self-isolation rules?
item.description: Changes have been announced to guidelines in England on exercise and social distancing.

item.title: Coronavirus update: What are the symptoms of coronavirus?
item.description: The BBC’s Laura Foster explains how you can recognise the symptoms of coronavirus.

item.title: Coronavirus: Who should wear a face mask or face covering?
item.description: For the first time, people in England are being advised to wear face coverings in some situations.

item.title: Coronavirus: What tests are being done in the UK?
item.description: What are the tests for coronavirus, who are they for and how do they work?

item.title: Coronavirus information: What should I do now?
item.description: Step-by-step, what to do to help prevent the spread of the virus.

item.title: Coronavirus: When will I be able to go on holiday?
item.description: Is it now possible to go on holiday, either in the UK or abroad?

item.title: Coronavirus and hydroxychloroquine: What do we know?
item.description: President Trump says he takes the drug as a preventative measure. But what do we know about its effectiveness?

item.title: Coronavirus vaccine: When will we have one?
item.description: We answer some of the big questions about vaccines and how long one for coronavirus could take.

item.title: Coronavirus: What's the risk on public transport?
item.description: Bus and train operators are reducing services and increasing cleaning.

item.title: Coronavirus pandemic: Tracking the global outbreak
item.description: Key maps and charts explaining how the respiratory virus has spread around the world and how it is being dealt with.

item.title: Coronavirus symptoms: What are they and how do I protect myself?
item.description: Loss of taste and smell have been added to the UK's list of coronavirus symptoms.

item.title: Coronavirus: When did care homes go into lockdown?
item.description: Many thousands of care home residents have died from coronavirus, but when were key decisions made?

item.title: Coronavirus: How long does it take to recover?
item.description: Recovery from Covid-19 can be a lengthy process, depending on how seriously people get the virus.

item.title: Coronavirus: Will schools be able to reopen in June?
item.description: There are differing views on whether English schools should reopen in June.

item.title: Coronavirus: How lockdown is being lifted across Europe
item.description: As the UK alters its restrictions, how are other European countries reopening after lockdown?

item.title: Coronavirus: How will the Covid-19 alert system work?
item.description: The threat of Covid-19 in England is to be ranked through a five-level, colour-coded alert system.

item.title: Coronavirus: How much will it cost the UK?
item.description: The pandemic will cost the government hundreds of billions of pounds. Where will it all come from?

item.title: Coronavirus lockdown: Am I allowed to move house?
item.description: The easing of lockdown will affect those who want to buy or sell a home, or rent somewhere new, in England.

item.title: Coronavirus: What powers do the police have?
item.description: Police across the UK now have wide-ranging powers to help fight the coronavirus pandemic.

item.title: How reopened schools in Denmark keep children safely apart
item.description: What's it like in a school that has re-opened? Denmark and Germany show how it might look.

item.title: Coronavirus bubbles: How do they work and who is in yours?
item.description: "Bubbles" of people we can meet safely may form part of the plans to ease lockdown in England.

item.title: Coronavirus: Does lockdown easing 'follow the science'?
item.description: Why is England pressing ahead with plans to ease lockdown rules ahead of the rest of the UK?

item.title: Coronavirus: What does it mean if I've been furloughed by work?
item.description: Millions unable to do their job due to coronavirus will have their wages paid by a new scheme.

item.title: How do I travel to work now?
item.description: Some people are being encouraged to go back to work, but how will they get there?

item.title: How to make your own face mask
item.description: Our guide to different types of face coverings and step-by-step instructions on how to make them.

item.title: Coronavirus: Do I have to go back to work after lockdown?
item.description: With lockdown restrictions eased, people may start going back to work. But what are your rights?

item.title: Coronavirus R0: What is the R number and why does it matter?
item.description: Experts keep discussing the value of R, but what is it and why does it matter?

item.title: Coronavirus: What is the UK's test, track and trace strategy?
item.description: A guide to the three key parts of the government's coronavirus strategy after lockdowns are eased.

item.title: Coronavirus: What are the UK travel quarantine rules?
item.description: What do you need to know if you're planning to fly during the Covid-19 pandemic?

item.title: Coronavirus: Intensive care and other key terms explained
item.description: Use our tool to check the meaning of key words and phrases associated with the Covid-19 outbreak.

item.title: Coronavirus: Labour's Starmer says PM statement 'raises as many questions as answers'
item.description: People are being told to go back to work without clear safety guidance, Labour leader Keir Starmer says.

item.title: Plinofficial: Russian rapper who loved dollars arrested by FBI
item.description: A cash-flaunting rapper from Siberia came to the US to become a global star. Where did it go wrong?
